resources.string: Please define a new master password
Initialisation succeeded, you may now login\nPlease enter your master password
Fields have been modified\nclick CANCEL to close without saving
Password should not have\nleading or trailing white-space
Specify the export filename to be written into directory:\n
Access to public storage has previously been denied\nGo to settings/apps/eskey to grant permission
Access to public storage not permitted
The external storage media is not available for read/write access\nPerhaps it is not mounted
Select the storage type.\nPrivate storage needs adb/root to access.\nPublic storage requires granting STORAGE permission

Eskey manages a local store of encrypted data. 

The cipher-text (ie, encrypted) data may be backed up and restored using local files. You may also export and import the data as clear-text (ie, as un-encrypted data). 

When performing file I/O operations, the user specifies whether to access the private storage directory or the public storage directory. 

If you select the public storage directory, then you must grant the app storage access permission. This permission may be revoked (or re-granted) by editing the app settings. The public storage directory is normally shared (eg, as a mounted USB drive to a host computer). 

No special permission is needed for Eskey to access the private storage directory. Note that the private storage directory is not shared by Android and can typically only be accessed by root (eg, adb/debugging technique).

Enter the new password and the confirmation-password, 
and press CHANGE PASSWORD 

If the password change is successful, Eskey will logout 
and return you to the login screen, 
where you may re-login using the new password.
Text has been entered; press CANCEL to close
Password change succeeded, you may now login\nPlease enter your master password
